Pre-Game Insights: The ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2022 title clash between Pakistan and England is going to take place on 13 November.
International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the match officials for the final.
Umpires Marais Erasmus and Kumar Dharmasena will be on-field duties at the iconic Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
The TV umpire will be Chris Gaffaney and the fourth umpire will be Paul Reiffel.
England is in good form and recently thrashed India by 10 wickets, winning the match in just 16 overs.
Buttler and Hales led England to victory with scores of 80 and 86 runs respectively.
Pakistan had a rollercoaster journey but made a comeback to reach the finals.
Pakistan defeated New Zealand by seven wickets to reach the final.
Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan's key half-centuries helped Pakistan reach the final.
Pakistan has the second-finest Powerplay economy rate (6.19) and an average of (18.58).
